original_title: Thinner than Two Ten-Thousandths of a Millimetre
overview: Soap suds, framing devices, and computer screen glare constitute the raw material from which a highly fragile cosmos of the “infra-thin” unfolds, one step at a time.  Gregor Eldarb is a visual artist from Vienna, Austria. He has shown his work in solo and group exhibitions internationally and at the Festival du Nouveau Cinéma in Montreal, IndieLisboa International Film Festival in Lisbon, and the Ann Arbor Film Festival. His awards and grants include residencies at WIELS in Brussels and the International Studio and Curatorial Program in New York. www.gregoreldarb.com
title: Thinner than Two Ten-Thousandths of a Millimetre
